class_notes:
(Same as JS 270 1, HIST 270 1)
This course is a survey of Jewish history from antiquity to the present. It presumes no prior knowledge of Jewish history, religion or culture. We will examine how Jews have defined themselves socially and politically in a number of historical and geographical settings, how Jewish theology and religious practice have been shaped and transformed, and how Jews have interacted with and responded to the societies in which they have lived. A central question during the ancient period will be, what was "Judaism" and
how did it emerge out of the diverse religious landscape of antiquity? The medieval period will focus on the interface between Jewish communities and the states or empires in which they lived.
course_description: This course offers a general overview of the history of Jews and Judaism, beginning with the Biblical period and ending with modern times.
